isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION SHIFT LINKAGE - INSTALL

step1.para: Place transmission shift lever down and rearward ( Item 11, Figure 2) onto the transmission selector shaft ( Item 15, Figure 2) far enough to install retaining nut. Move transmission shift lever to a detent position other than reverse or first gear detent position. Reverse and first are at opposite ends of the transmission shift lever travel arc. Position lever in a midway detent position which is between reverse and first. Do not drive lever onto shaft. Be sure lever is indexed with flats on the selector shaft. Install nut.

caution.para: Since the mating parts are a tapered fit, the lever cannot be fully installed initially. The lever will go onto the machined flats of shaft far enough to be properly indexed, then it is moved against the shoulder of the shaft by tightening retaining nut. If lever is forced onto shaft by hammering or bumping, the selector shaft components inside transmission housing will be damaged. The lever should be held when tightening the retaining nut in Step 2 because of possible damage to selector detent lever and spring roller components inside transmission. Push selector lever onto flats of selector shaft.

step1.para: Grasp lever and while holding it, tighten nut to 15 to 20 ft-lbs. (20 to 27 Nm).

caution.para: Torque in excess of 20 ft-lbs. (27 Nm) will damage threads on selector shaft.

step1.para: Upon completing installation of shift lever, move lever thru detent range positions to check for freedom from binding and positive detent engagement.
